articles.author: EditorDavid
articles.title: Will a Pandemic Wave of Automation Be Bad News for Workers?
articles.description:
The New York Times reports:
When Kroger customers in Cincinnati shop online these days, their groceries may be picked out not by a worker in their local supermarket but by a robot in a nearby warehouse... And in the drive-through lane at Checkers near Atlanta…

articles.title: US-wide, non-white neighborhoods are hotter than white ones
articles.description: In cities and towns across the United States, neighborhoods with more Black, Hispanic and Asian residents experience hotter temperatures during summer heatwaves than nearby white residents, a new study finds.
articles.content: IMAGE: The interactive map shows the widespread race and class disparities in extreme summer surface temperatures across the United States. This map only shows counties with more than 10 census tract… [+6776 chars]

articles.author: Ailan Evans
articles.title: WHO Calls For Increased Oversight, Ethical Standards On Human Genome Editing
articles.description: The World Health Organization released two reports Monday providing recommendations to governments and health officials regarding human genome editing.
articles.content:
The World Health Organization (WHO) released two reports Monday providing recommendations to governments and health officials regarding the controversial practice of human genome editing.
